Art Deco style but not over the top. They haven't installed their A/C yet, so it was quite hot inside. Hopefully they'll fix that soon.
author: Alfred L.

description:
First, I should clarify I am a pretty picky about bars. I want tasty cocktails with top shelf hooch, a nice ambiance, a place where I can sit and have a drink or chat with a companion and for a reasonable price. But I don't like TVs (volume on or off), places that are on trend and more about a gimmick than just sitting down with a drink or so crowded you have to shout over the din of 75 other people and sound like you smoked a pack of unfiltered ciggies the next day. 

When I first came across Stookey's on the corner of Bush and Taylor, I was a bit suspicious. It seemed overly bright inside, like someone was going to be performing an alien autopsy, and I wasn't sure if they were a bar or a place to eat. So for the first few months it was open (and it hasn't been open long), I didn't even set food inside. Months wasted. 

But on the recommendation of a friend, and seeing they had put in some gels to dim the lights, I popped in one night. It's a young spot, they don't have a specific crowd yet, but they make delicious cocktails and have a nice selection of top shelf booze - your Tempus Fugit liquors, Glengoyne scotch, a variety of nice gins, a great selection of bitters, etc. If you want the well vodka with whatever or something with a maraschino cherry or anything just to get buzzed, this is not your place. They are aiming for craft and quality. But if you are into ambiance, they are trying to bring back the old school service: the waiters make you think of the bar from the Shining, but in a good, not murdering your family way, the glassware makes you feel like you are at a private houseparty in the 30s, and it is all well thought out. And the selection of cocktails are well-chosen (although you can order other things, too). And the pricing is what you would spend on a tasty cocktail anywhere else in the city, sometimes, it's even a little less. The place is small with a long L-shape bar and a few tables, but you can sit and chat with the knowledgeable bar staff (who have had tenure at spots all over the City) or with your friends or stare at your phone, if you wish.  

It's a nice spot. And they are planning a few future events that take advantage of their high quality, unrushed aesthetic. I'm hoping it stays around. If you know your Savoy cocktails and want a tasty, well made cocktail in a spot with no televisions and no blaring music, this is the place for you. And as it seasons with time, (I think it has only been open 4 months) I suspect it will get even better. Viva Stookey's Corpse Reviver #2!
author: M. M.

description: A fine location with great atmosphere and friendly people. The 'blood and sand' was great!
author: Mike V.

description: Watched this place being remodeled in my neighborhood for such a long time.  I've visited a few times now.  My favorite bartender is Tim.  The drinks are crafted without attitude and in a really amazing environment.  The detail of the interior even down to the music makes for a delightful experience. The drinks are served in unique glasses in keeping with the type of cocktail ordered, super nice touch. So happy to welcome Stookey's to the neighborhood!
author: Elaina S.

description: This is great little bar, with and excellent classic cocktail, menu, wonderful ambiance and decor, good service and knowledgeable staff.
author: Oliver C.

description: This place was very cool.  It was so much fun watching the bartender mix drinks.  Real drinks done with care and precision.  (They do measure everything.)  One downside is that it can get quite loud when there are loud people in there.  They also don't have any food options which is a bummer.  We will certainly return though because we loved the bartender and the vibe of the place.
author: J J.

description: I really like this place. It's a throwback to the post Prohibition era. The drinks are a little pricey but you only need two of them. I highly recommend it.  Say Hi to Danielle and Tim.
author: Timothy H.

description:
This was not originally on the top of our list of places to try out when on our most recent trip into the city, but we could not have been happier to have had this bar land on our radar! It was Christmas Eve and we were having trouble locating places that weren't closed early for the holidays, after several phone calls to places on our "list" we landed on this bar on Google Maps, so we gave them a call, and the bartender that answered the phone said "of course we are open this evening, and we are toasting Tom & Jerry at 10pm" ... so of course we were intrigued enough to walk the few blocks from our hotel to check out this bar! We walked into Stookey's and were welcomed with a 1950's Soda Fountain type of set up, with Old Fashioned Christmas Tree Lights hung around the bar which gave it the most perfect holiday feel. It was pretty quiet as we'd expected it to be on Christmas Eve, but the bartender was excellent, and helpful with suggestions. For whatever reason, I was in the mood for Rum, and ordered an "Old Cuban" while my boyfriend asked for a suggestion and was recommended an Eggnog Cocktail with Scotch, and they were both delicious! We were still intrigued by this whole "Tom and Jerry ordeal" wondering if some cartoonists were going to walk into the door any minute, or a mouse and a cat, or two famous bar patrons, so we decided to order another drink and settle in and wait until 10pm. At about 9:50 we asked the bartender what exactly was happening at 10pm and he told us about a traditional holiday drink called a Tom & Jerry and that the owner was making a batch of them for the holidays, so of course... we stayed for a 3rd cocktail and waited. 

We watched the owner, who was with his friends, all dressed up in 1950s fashion begin to concoct the drinks from scratch using real eggs, sugar, milk and ingredients. and to top it off they had an antique "Tom and Jerry" cocktail set that the drinks were poured into. It was delicious, well worth the wait! We had two cups each before deciding that we'd better go find some food before everything shut down for the evening!

We had two bartenders during our visit, both experts at their craft and both incredibly professional and making this "themed" location seem all that more real. It was the perfect spot for Christmas Eve and we felt so festive and cozy in this little bar. 

The Old Cuban and Mai Tai were both excellent, although I'd definitely recommend the Cuban first, and the Eggnog Scotch Martinis were excellent. And if you happen to be in the city next Christmas Eve... I'd recommend dressing up and heading over for a Tom & Jerry!
author: L B.

description: We had a great time stopping in for a drink before our show.  A real 1930s era bar with craft cocktails.  Great bartender and the owner is great.  A group of us dropped in and they went out of their way to make us comfortable.
author: Robert D.

description: Great style and very knowledgeable staff/owner. The fernet flight was enlightening and - like any great bar - cocktails were made to my tastes and not just by the name I ordered. Can't believe it's not busier than it is...go there and enjoy it asap!!
author: Andy J.

description: Fantastic place for classic , yet up to date cocktails. Danielle could not be any better.
author: O C.
